00001 #ifndef MATHCURSOR_H
00002 #define MATHCURSOR_H
00003 
00004 #include "mmlnode.h"
00005 #include "boundpoint.h"
00006 
00007 /* MathCursor implements a cursor that is positioned somewhere in a MathML DOM.
00008 
00009    The specification DOM2-Traversal-Range could also be used for such an object,
00010    but has a few problems:
00011    - position in the DOM and text version of a document are not mapped 1 to 1
00012    - range and traversal are defined seperately, while a cursor usually
00013      traverses a document and is also placed at a certain position in a document
00014      The Traversal specification does not specify how to walk through text
00015      nodes. A cursor in a MathML document would want to do that.
00016      Even in the Range specification a more fine-grained position specifiation
00017      is used!
00018 */
00019 
00020 class MathCursor {
00021 public:
00022         MathCursor(MMLDocument *o);
00023         MMLNode *movePrevious(); // previous
00024         MMLNode *moveNext(); // next
00025         MMLNode *moveUp(); // towards the leaves
00026         MMLNode *moveDown(); // towards the root
00027         MMLNode *moveRight();
00028         MMLNode *moveLeft();
00029         bool moveTo(float, float);
00030         void selectNext();
00031         void selectPrevious();
00032         bool selectTo(float, float);
00033         MMLNode *container() const;
00034         long offset() const;
00035         MMLNode *leftNode() const;
00036         MMLNode *rightNode() const;
00037         void setBeforeNode(MMLNode *);
00038         void setAfterNode(MMLNode *);
00039         int nearness(const MMLNode *) const;
00040         bool isSelected(const MMLNode *) const;
00041         bool collapsed() const { return collaps; }
00042         float getX() { return x; }
00043         float getY() { return y; }
00044         const BoundPoint &cursor() const;
00045         const BoundPoint &left() const;
00046         const BoundPoint &right() const;
00047 private:
00048         // the node the cursor is in
00049 //      MMLNode *current;
00050         // the document the cursor belongs to
00051         MMLDocument *owner;
00052         BoundPoint cur, sel, *start, *end;
00053         bool curmouse, selmouse;
00054 //      MMLNode *startLPSA, *endLPSA; // lowest partially selected ancestor
00055         MMLNode *hca; // highest common ancestor
00056         bool collaps; // if collapsed is true, sel is equal to cur
00057         // it's not equal in this class, but setting a bool is quicker than
00058         // copying the object
00059 
00060         // the depth at which the cursor aims to be
00061         // this value is changed with moveUp() and moveDown() and help when
00062         // navigating with moveLeft() and moveRight()
00063         uint targetlevel;
00064         // the coordinates the cursor was last sent to
00065         // these are temporary/debug variables
00066         float x, y;
00067 
00068         // returns the square of the distance of point x, y to node n.
00069         // x and y are points in the coordinate system of the parent of n
00070         float distToNode(float x, float y, MMLNode *n) const;
00071         // recursively scan all nodes in node n and
00072         // return the node without child nodes that is nearest to the point x, y
00073         // x and y are points in the coordinate system of of n
00074         MMLNode *getNearestNode(float x, float y, MMLNode *n, float &mindist)
00075                 const;
00076         bool unwantedPos(const BoundPoint &) const;
00077         bool moveTo(float, float, BoundPoint &) const;
00078         void collapse();
00079         void initRange();
00080         void updateSelection();
00081 };
